abstract: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services says almost third of United States nursing homes have had their star ratings lowered after readjustment of quality standards, which was done to address complaints about inaccuracy of ratings; nursing home industry criticizes adjustment, but advocates for nursing home residents hail changes as long overdue.
lead_paragraph: The previous rating system relied so heavily on unverified information that even homes with a documented history of quality problems were earning top ratings.

headline.main: Medicare Toughens Standards on Nursing Homes
